name: Omni San Francisco Hotel

reviews.text: Fabulous location, a 10 minute walk to North Beach, 5 minutes to Chinatown. Cable car stop across the street. Rooms were great, couldn't get very good cell phone reception inside, but that is the only negative.
reviews.title: Best Omni out there? Might be!

reviews.text: Good bed, spacious enough room, nice products, excellent shower head pressure. A delightful stay.
reviews.title: Best Customer Service of Any Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed at the Omni for a birthday and girls weekend. This hotel is not only comfortable and beautiful, the customer service is the best of any hotel I have stayed. Everyone is friendly and more than accomadating. They also gave us a bag of spa treasures. Free coffee and juice brought to your room if you are a select member. I will be staying at only Omni Hotels in my travels.
reviews.title: INCREDIBLE SERVICE AND LOCATION JUST EXCELLET

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Me and my husband stay 3 days at the Omni Hotel, the services was excellent, the staff was super friendly and always there for anything you may need... The location one of the best in San Francisco..... I highly recommended this hotel to anyone thinking of traveling to San Fco, belive me you will not regreted......... EXCELLENT.....
reviews.title: The best stay we've had in San Francisco

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: From the moment we arrived the Omni San Francisco outdid its competitors. The front desk was efficient and greeted us warmly, the bellman was helpful and gracious about the tip. For the first time I can remember we had a handwritten note from the housekeeper welcoming us. The hotel had responded to my request for a room on a high floor and , while one might expect them to be cynical since I know people are sometimes dishonest about a special event, a bottle of champagne and chocolate covered strawberries, with another handwritten note from the concierge, was waiting for us on our first night.. We've stayed at five star hotels for years in SF but our knees will no longer climb (or descend) Nob Hill comfortably and the Omni was our choice because of that. We would recommend it to anyone and will seek out Omnis whenever we travel.
reviews.title: Excellent Luxury Base

reviews.text: I was in the 5 star hotel business for 10 years (many years ago) around the world and now travel on business internationally on a constant basis, The Omni front desk team is one of the best I have seen anywhere in the world. They were the perfect blend of welcoming, informative, fast & professional. This hotel is exceptionally good value, it is welcoming, well maintained, in a great location and the rooms are very clean and comfortable. Thank you Omni San Francisco, you are one on the very best hotels in the USA and right up there with the best service I have had in the world. Can you tell we loved our stay at the Omni?
reviews.title: Professional Courtesy

reviews.text: We stayed in a King while our kids were in the adjoining Pottery Barn kids room. They loved it ... a kids dream come true! Our King room was clean and well appointed with old time luxury plus modern amenities. The kids had bunk beds plus a fold out couch, table and chairs, bean bags, a good library of books, TV with DVD player, and a mini fridge stocked with emergency snacks. Most importantly, they had cookies and milk delivered to their room every night! The Omni itself is beautiful, nestled between the Financial District and Chinatown, and is right on the California cable car line. Tremendous service that was kind and present, but never overbearing. One of our best hotel experiences ever!
reviews.title: Family luxury in the heart of San Francisco

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in the Omni San Francisco for 3 days for our 5 year anniversary. The hotel is in a great location in the city, walking distance to many attractions. The room was perfect and the service was outstanding. Reserve in advance on the hotel's web site for the best rates.
reviews.title: Wonderful hotel! Great location and service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed at the Omni San Francisco for four nights on holiday and was very impressed. Really nice hotel, nice rooms, very clean,very good bed, friendly staff and also in an excellent location.
reviews.title: Great hotel all round

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It took me forever to try to figure out which hotel to stay at in San Francisco, since there are so many to choose from, I couldnt have made a better choice..Everyone was so friendly as soon as we arrived. The rooms were very clean and nice, the maid service was on point. We recieved a nice welcoming gift, which was thoughtful for such a big hotel.. We never visited San Fran before so we needed lots of direction and all the staff members made it a million times easier to make it around : ) I highly recommend this hotel to anyone booking a trip to this fun city : )
reviews.title: absolutely best choice...

reviews.text: Went out to Frisco for vacation with my wife in April. Our stay at the Omni was outstanding. First class all the way. Very helpful staff, great room, excellent service, and very close to all the best attractions. The omni is just a few blks from North Beach which has several great places to eat and drink.
reviews.title: The Best in San Fran!
Solid Four Star Pick in Financial District
reviews.text: One thing I would recomend is to get a limo from the airport to your hotel. A limo cost us $45 plus tip wereas a cab is just over $40 plus tip. Hey, why not arive in style?

reviews.title: Awesome
reviews.text: While my wife and I normally stay at newer, trendier properties, the San Francisco Omni won us over with it's friendly, professional staff and convienent location. While our 17th story King room didn't offer the best views (think portholes for windows), the room itself was clean, quiet, well appointed, but not spectacular. Housekeeping did a fine job maintaining the room, but neglected to ensure a second roll of toilet paper was available. The mints offered during the evening turndown service were a nice touch.

The hotel is more of a business hotel than resort property...no pools, spas, activity rooms, or even a small gift shop to be found. The business center did offer computers with complimentary high speed internet access, and the health club offered a variety of workout machines.
reviews.title: Hard to Top This

reviews.text: Located midway between the Wharf and Union Square, and on the California street cable car line, the S.F. Omni is nicely located in the center of the financial district...seemingly hundreds of ATM's within a couple of blocks. Most attractions are easily within walking distance...but beware the hills, they can be a full blown cardio workout.
reviews.title: Ohhhhhh the Omni

reviews.text: I used to live in SF, so when I go back to visit friends.. this is the ONLY place I will stay.
reviews.title: My Favorite SF Hotel
Top hotel - all round top choice
reviews.text: When I lived there, I had about 100 guests come into town for my wedding, and they all stayed at the OMNI. (Including myself) The service is amazing, the staff is the best and this is the best priced 4-5 star hotel in the entire city. (Unless you go South of Market, but it's not as CLEAN in that area)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We arrived very late after a long drive from Vegas as part of our honeymoon tour of CA, and were greeted by exceptionally friendly helpful staff, unbelievably clean rooms, excellent facilities...need I go on. An absolute must for an extra special city visit.
reviews.title: This is what every hotel should aim to be like

reviews.text: I was in San Francisco on business and stayed at the Omni for four nights this June. EVERYTHING is great about this hotel! The staff are extremely friendly, and will go out of their way to help you with ANYTHING you could possibly need. I've stayed at other hotels in San Francisco and there are hotels that more modern / chique, but none of them beat the Omni - It's a classic.
reviews.title: Best hotel in San Francisco

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in this hotel on a recent visit to san franciso and would highly recommend it, from start to finish the service was impeccable and i could not find one thing to fault. On arriving at the hotel we were greeted by the friendly porter and directed to the front desk where again the welcome was great (but not overwhelming) and check in was quick and efficent. Room was excellent - very comfortable with a huge bed and excellent bathroom (good shower). For me it was the little touches that made the stay so enjoyable - the chocolates, the ice bucket that was refilled every night, the weather forecast by the phone; as well as the attentive and friendly staff. As we spent most of our time sightseeing we only ate room service one night and never ate in the restauarant - both restauarant and bar looked very nice though. Location is great - walking distance from all the sights though can be a bit quiet on a sunday. If im in san francisco again this is where ill be staying!
reviews.title: would highly recommend this hotel

reviews.text: We stayed at the Omni hotel after reading all the reviews on Trip advisor. I have to say that they were true! The Omni hotel is a great place with a very friendly staff. We arrived early (10:30a) and a room was waiting for us. After signing up on their website, we ended up with coffee and juice delivered to our room every morning. We also had breakfast included. The restaurant was great. The staff there welcomed us each morninng and we had the choice as far as menu. I had steak and eggs one morning. Just fabulous! The meat was very tender.
reviews.title: Great hotel, location and friendly staff!

reviews.text: We will definetely stay there again. Perfect location as well.
reviews.title: Best Hotel Experience Ever!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: All of the prior reviews are true - the Omni is excellent. It may have been the nicest hotel we have ever stayed in - definitely in the top two.
reviews.title: Excellent Stay at the Omni

reviews.text: We stayed for two nights at the end of July. We had a 15th floor room with a partial view of the city. The rate we paid included valet parking for each night, normally an additional $48 per night charge. The room was large and very clean. The bathroom had a double sink with a very large countertop.
reviews.title: Excellent Service

reviews.text: The hotel was very convenient to Chinatown and Fisherman's Wharf. The entrance to Chinatown was only a short walk from the hotel and the cable car route to Fisherman's Wharf stopped right in front of the hotel. Our rental car was parked on Friday afternoon and we did not retrieve it until we left on Sunday.
reviews.title: Very Nice
Our stay at the Omni was great!
reviews.text: The service had the hotel was exemplary. Each employee we encountered was very friendly and helpful. The hotel concierge gave us a great overview of the area and the doormen provided excellent dining tips.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As members of Omni's Select Guest program, we were treated with complimentary beverage service each morning, consisting of a pot of coffee and tea and a choice of several fruit juices, along with a choice of three newspapers. This service was very prompt - we requested 8:00 each morning, and the beverages arrived by 7:30. This service allowed us to enjoy our coffee and tea and newspaper before heading out to breakfast. Two excellent breakfast locations within walking distance were Lori's Diner and Sears' Fine Food.
reviews.title: Loved it! Fabulous Anniversary!!!!

likes.liked: — The staff is wonderful and make everyone feel like a special guest.
likes.disliked: — Our typical San Francisco hotel view of the back of other buildings, but that is the usual and can't be helped.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a return trip to the Omni and from the moment we pulled up in our car and the doorman greeted us by name, to the warm greeting (by name)at the front desk, that made us feel like we were a favorite relative ( and not that our names were being read off of the computer), we have felt most welcome. Another small example of the same superb staff is that when we leave a small tip for the houskeeping staff, we always receive a thank you note in response.
reviews.title: Christmas Magic, Greeted as if I Were Santa Claus

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The accomodations are delightful, this we have come to expect, but what really makes the Omni as destination to be desired is the staff. We are greeted each morning by the lovely woman who brings our breakfast as if we are the only customers in the world.
reviews.title: Why would you stay anyplace else in San Francisco?

reviews.text: Do not underestimate the accomodations, the most confortable bed in America. You will leave you heart at the Omni!
reviews.title: Hands down best hotel experience!

reviews.text: This is a five-star hotel at three-star prices. Terrific location. We walked to Chinatown; to the Embarcadero; to North Beach and all those great Italian restaurants. Great shopping & sightseeing nearby. The rooms are nicely maintained. When all is said and done, it is the service that keeps me coming back, for this, my fourth Christmas. The employees are always so accommodating, from Daryll at the door, to Sarah on the front desk. Overall, a wonderful experience.
reviews.title: Glad we returned

reviews.text: I stayed twice, in two different rooms. Both were HUGE by any standard, but especially for San Francisco. My room at the Hilton was about 1/3 the size. The bathrooms are AMAZING: large tub, lots of thick towels, and lots of space. The furniture in the room has an antique feel, but in that upper crust Euro way, not in that shabby chic kind of way. The beds are firm but comfortable, and the linens are soft. You can get down pillows or foam. Tons of room and a big picture window, and the place was quiet enough to get a good night's sleep--which is never my experience. During the holidays they gave my sister and I welcome gift bags and had a champagne reception in the lobby, which is also beautiful. But the best thing about the Omni was the service. Everyone was fantastic, from doormen to front desk staff. Helpful, courteous, and friendly. They let me check in early after my all night flight from Japan, gave us directions multiple times, helped us with parking, and kept our stuff for hours after we checked out. I will stay here whenever I'm in SF again. We liked them so much we brought them homemade cookies on our second stay.
reviews.title: Just Do It!

reviews.text: I just returned from a wonderful 4 day in San Francisco, and 3 nights at the Omni Hotel San Francisco was a treat. I aways stay there now, and the accommodations, amenities, and staff are the best of any hotel I know. it is well-located and to me it is paradise away from home in America's favorite city.
reviews.title: The best hotel anywhere

reviews.text: Martin I. Laichtman, M.D.
reviews.title: Living Large In San Francisco!

likes.disliked: — The rooms were a little boring.

reviews.text: Giving this hotel 5 stars is easy with the type of service they deliver! I am a believer!
reviews.title: Hit or Miss hotel

likes.disliked: — Below average room at above average cost

reviews.text: I pulled up after a night at the newly finished J.W. Marriott hotel in Union Square, bad planning on my part. I was denied late check out and feeling a little green; I thought I would take my chances on an early check-in at the Omni. Having booked through Travelocity, my hopes were not high. I was greeted by the extremely efficient and professional Evelyn. She was kind, sympathetic and sincere. I was not a lesser human being for booking a discount room from an online service, hurray! I was feeling better. Evelyn clicked away on her keyboard and had me in a room within 10 minutes, my day was turning around. Enter Fernando, the very pleasant and chatty bellman that seemed to know everyone. He whisked my luggage away and we had a nice conversation.
reviews.title: wonderful omni

likes.liked: — nothing too much trouble for staff
likes.disliked: — no free internet except on own pc in the lobby

reviews.text: I arrived in the simple, yet elegant room to find a handwritten note from the housekeeper, Suyuak. I am a sucker for the personal touch. Slipping into a comfortable robe provided by the hotel, I decided to order room service, a Kobe burger would surely bring me around. The burger arrived and it was delicious! The meat was lightly spiced with a hint of pepper and the melted cheddar was just right! The fries were lightly spiced and delicious too. My high school reunion was 5 hours away and I was starting to feel human again. After a nice nap on the comfortable bed it was time to shower and head out for the evening.
reviews.title: Terrific Stay

likes.liked: — Everything ....my kids really liked the cookies and milk delivered to the room each afternoon!

reviews.title: Beautiful/Quiet
reviews.text: The Omni Hotel is beautiful and quiet. Now this isn't the Four Seasons, but it is still along the same lines. Rooms were spacious and elegant and very comftoable and inviting. They even have turn down service in the evening, which is an added bonus.

reviews.title: First Class Hotel
reviews.text: The best thing about this place was the gym. All I can say is awesome!!!! The lighting is great, the equipment was top notch, well taken care of by staff, stocked with towls, headphones, water, etc.

reviews.title: Beautiful hotel
reviews.text: AWESOME!

reviews.title: They surpassed my expectations!
reviews.text: Only drawback is that it is a little pricey to say the least. Items in room are a plenty, but it will cost you. My suggestion is to leave those kinds of things alone. LoL

reviews.title: Very Good
reviews.text: I would stay here again.

reviews.title: I'll be back!
reviews.text: From the moment the front door was opened on our way in to check in to the time the front door was opened on our way after check out, my girlfriend and I were treated like royalty at the Omni. I've been to San Francisco many times and the Omni is the BEST hotel I've stayed in. The service is exquisite. Everyone from the doorman to the front desk personnel to the housekeeping staff is exceptionally friendly, always upbeat, and very helpful. The hotel itself is very clean, elegant, and conveniently located close to Chinatown, North Beach, and the Financial District. The California Street Cable Car line runs past the hotel's front door, and the BART station is five blocks away. The room was large, clean, and well maintained. There was a nice flat screen TV and DVD player in our upgraded "signature" room, though not every room may be equipped similarly. Every morning our housekeeper would leave us a handwritten note wishing us a pleasant day. We'd write her back telling her of our travel adventures and leave her a well-deserved tip for her service. She even recommended a great place to try authentic dim sum! Staying at the Omni was definitely the key to a most enjoyable San Francisco adventure! I'll be back to San Francisco soon and, without a doubt, will be staying at the Omni again!

We have stayed in the Omni San Francisco before so it was the natural choice for a return visit. The staff in general were helpful particularly the door men - it is nice to get the door opened for you!
reviews.title: Good hotel in central location

reviews.text: We had a few probs - the keys issued to our party did not open the doors and we were left standing on the corridor with our luggage whist the security checked our ID again before they could re-issue our cards - no proper apology from the reception desk as I would have expected. Also we had one of our rooms booked for three but only one king bed !- they sent up a rollaway - at no extra charge - I would hope so as we had paid for 3 people!
reviews.title: loved the omni

likes.disliked: — high food prices and small rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had booked a suite and a bedroom and they put us in the corner suite area which was very handy - suite was quite spacious - flowers in bathroom and fruit were supplied - nice touch. Beware double beds are tiny and really do not fit 2 people. Thet now charge for use of their internet business room - so take your laptop - it is free for 'select guests ' in the lobby - you can print airline boarding passes for free for a restricted number of airlines - but would be better if they had access to international ones as well! Overall a nice hotel - though like many hotels in San francisco it is quite pricey - SF hotels are pricier than NYC or Boston Breakfast is expensive for what you get - much better value in the Omni in Boston! - which is hard to beat for breakfast!
reviews.title: I can see why the Omni is rated so high.
10 in all areas
reviews.text: The omni was a great location. The hotel was nice, with nice rooms. What made the stay so great was the service. All the staff were really grade a from beginning to end. The things I didn't like was that the room was very small, with only two double beds, not queen. The food prices were very high, even for san francisco, so eating at the hotel was not an option. Would have been convenient to eat at hotel for breakfast.

Our stay at the Omni during the week of Thansgiving was outstanding. We went with our 2 young children (5 and 2). Check in was excellent - with back packs containing games for the children. The room was very clean and well maintained each day. Location was excellent - easy to walk around, get on cable cars or travel by taxi.
reviews.title: Outstanding Hotel

reviews.text: Above all the Omni was a cut above any hotel we have stayed at due to the attitude of the employees. All of them were friendly and looking to help in anyway they could. We had never stayed at an Omni before but will now consider it on every trip where they have a hotel located. Highly recommended.
reviews.title: Wonderful Place to Stay

reviews.text: We really enjoyed our time at the hotle. The service and food were wonderful. Our room was a good size and it was very clean. It located in a very good location and would def consider saying there again.
reviews.title: Outstanding service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I travel to San Francisco a couple of times each year and have been fairly loyal to the Hilton Financial District which has a great location and wonderful views. I have had drinks in the bar at the Omni and thought it was lovely. This time, I found a terrific weekend price at the Omni and decided to try it. It was a great decision. From the moment I walked in the door, the service was uniformly outstanding. The doorman asks for the name on the reservation - and from there, they hand you off, by name, from staff member to staff member. I was particularly impressed when the next morning, the bellman still referred to me by name - good memory! The room I had was probably not the best location, but I didn't expect their best room for the price I paid! The room itself was lovely, extremely well equipped. It faced inwardly to other rooms of the hotel and a nearby office, but frankly that was wonderful because it was extremely quiet for sleeping. The location of the Omni in the center of town does not lend itself to views in any case. When I checked in, they gave me door tags to hang each night with a requested beverage (coffee, tea, juice, etc) for the morning. What I particularly liked was that on the back, you could also order small breakfast items - muffins, yogurt, etc. for a very reasonable price rather then ordering an expensive breakfast from the room service menu. If you were happy enough with coffee and a muffin for breakfast, it was possible for a very small charge. All in all it was a lovely hotel, I hope I can find another fairly reasonable offering in the future, as I would love to stay again.
reviews.title: Fantastically wonderful!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Everything about the hotel is lovely! We were celebrating my boyfriend's birthday and when we arrived they told us they'd upgraded us to a suite. It was a corner room and we had windows on both sides, a very nice sitting room, beautiful bathroom and huge bedroom. Everything about the room was first class. It was extremely clean and the bed was very comfortable. When we came back to the room after riding the cable cars around for a few hours there was a big piece of chocolate cake and a split of champagne waiting for us! We had dinner at Bob's, the hotels restaurant, and they gave us one of their intimate, private dining rooms. The food was wonderful! The hotel employees could not have been more helpful, welcoming and courteous. I can't say enough good things about our stay there and will definitely go back. I recommend it without hesitation!! Don't miss it, you'll love it!!!
reviews.title: Amazing service, location and comfort
Great stay at the Omni
reviews.text: My fiance and I stayed at the Omni for 1 night. I found the cheapest rates on the Omni Hotel's website. Unfortunately nothing else was cheap. $45/night for parking with unlimited in and out privileges. $70 for a steak. $34 for 3 cocktails. $70 for 3 mediocre martinis and 2 appetizers. The onion rings were pretty bad. There is free wi-fi in the lobby, but $10 for an internet connection in your room.

reviews.title: A great choice, whether you're there for business or for romance
reviews.text: The hotel was beautifully decorated for the holidays. All of the staff were very nice and courteous when we arrived. Security was very helpful when my fiance got locked in the stairwell (you can get into the stairwell, but you need a key to get onto the floors). There was complimentary hot cider and cookies for the guests in the lobby. I especially liked the gingerbread men. The rooms were very nice and spacious (for SF) with marble countertops and high thread count bedding. I loved their bathrobes. When we went back to our room at the end of the night the maid wrote a welcome note and left mint chocolates on the nightstand.

reviews.title: Great hotel for an anniversary stay
reviews.text: The hotel is located in the Financial district so lots of people go to the lobby bar after work. It's a few blocks from Union Square so we took a cab to get around town. I would have given the Omni 5 stars but some of the rates for food were ridiculous and the maids knocked on our door 4 times to clean the room.

reviews.title: Hotel stay part was great, marred by concierge and steakhouse
reviews.text: It may sound a bit strange, but I think it's true. Perfect for business and for romance too (not so for singles, partiers, families with kids and so on).

reviews.title: Great Hotel in a Great City
reviews.text: Elegant, quiet, perfectly located in a very good part of town ... I think the Omni really has it all. It's obsviously not an inexpensive choice, but their rates are very reasonable for what you get.
Just a short note to explain to you why I will never stay in another Omni Hotel.
reviews.title: Why I'll never stay at another Omni Hotel

reviews.text: I reserved a Signature Room at the Omni San Francisco Hotel through Hotels.com for 4 nights, arriving August 31 and leaving September 4, 2007.
reviews.title: Nice hotel, Annoying fees

reviews.text: When I arrived at the hotel I was informed that they had over-booked their rooms. I was told that I would be put in a lower cost standard room, a room without the Signature Room complimentary services. Needless to say, I was not happy about paying the Signature price for the lower cost room, this because I had paid in advance.
reviews.title: Great hotel with a luxurious feel - Not really for tourists
Absolutely Fantastic Stay
reviews.text: When I complained, I was offered a free breakfast. After I refused to accept the room they had offered, I was finally given a Signature Room. No doubt some other poor schmuck got stuck paying top dollar for a standard room. A first-class hotel would never have suggested downgrading a paying customer, regardless of how or how much they paid. But then, Omni isn’t a first-class hotel.

We stayed at the Omni over the 4th of July weekend (got a great rate at $169 a night)! We enjoyed everything about our stay there. From the doormen who were super, to the front desk staff and everyone in between--fabulous service. We liked the fact that it was not in the middle of everything, because San Francisco was crazy over that weekend! The financial district is very quiet on weekends, which, like another poster said, we liked. We were at the end of a 10 day trip out west and thought the Omni was the best hotel we stayed at, and we stayed at nice hotels! We checked in early, no problem, and when we were leaving they held our luggage all day because our flight wasn't until 10:00 that night. We loved all the personal touches and luxurious bedding and robes! As an added tip, we joined their hotel rewards program when making the reservations (it's free to join) and that got us extra perks like coffee/juice/paper in the morning, get fit kit and the room and a few more things. I would recommend this!
reviews.title: Omni was fabulous

reviews.text: This was our first visit at an Omni hotel and would look for an Omni property again when traveling.
reviews.title: Beautiful hotel, great location!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I just spent two nights at the Omni in San Francisco at the end of a 10-day trip to various California sites. We had three couples in our party. The hotel is beautifully decorated, had conscientious staff, great sheets.
reviews.title: Good 4-star hotel in a great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It's location is two blocks from Chinatown in the Financial District, and the street car runs right in front of the hotel. We needed quick transportation one evening in order to make our Alcatraz Tour, and the doorman provided two town cars for our party and we only had to tip the drivers.
reviews.title: 20th Anniversary Stay was Terrific

likes.disliked: — Price was higher than I would like

reviews.title: Loved the hotel, service sucked!
reviews.text: Because of its location, our 9th floor room overlooked the top of the Wells Fargo Bank and a Subway shop.

reviews.title: Morris loved the Omni San Francisco
reviews.text: The hotel is in the financial district but it is an easy walk to the harbor. The lobby is beautiful and the staff is very courteous and interested in helping you. The in-hotel restaurant is a steak house and the tab runs high. The room was spacious and pretty, was well appointed and included amenities.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I always have a hard time finding a hotel that's near all of the places I want to go, in a safe location, and is a little on the luxury side, yet at an affordable price. This hotel met and exceeded all of those criteria. It is on the edge of both the financial district and Chinatown. I believe it took about 15 minutes to walk down to Union Square where all the shopping is located. Luckily Boudin's Sourdough bread had a location in the lower level of Macy's so I didn't have to deal with all of the craziness of Fisherman's Wharf! Everyone at the hotel was dressed appropriately and behaved with the upmost professionalism. The room was was tastefully decorated and very clean. I especially liked how quite the room was. I didn't notice any loud annoying noises (ie: toilets, neighbors, slamming doors, etc.) All around a very pleasant stay.
reviews.title: Absolutely no complaints.All around clean, tasteful, and accommodating.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was my second stay here. I first stayed 2 years ago with my teen daughter as a mid-week getaway. This time I went with my spouse who had one day of business in SF so we decided to do a long weekend. We checked in on a Thursday and left (reluctantly) Sunday. I love the location -- easy walking distance to Chinatown, North Beach, Union Square, the Ferry building. Also easy to take the cable car back up California Street from Embarcadero. Only caveat is, on the weekend. most of the immediately local sandwich/soup shops are closed, catering as they do to local business lunchers.
reviews.title: Great home base for enjoying the city

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room was very nice, if a little quirky. It was on the top (17th) floor and was a suite with a separate living room. I say quirky only because the windows were all small and very high up so they let in the light but you could not really look out. We didn't care -- to us it was charming and comfortable The bathroom was nicely appointed with marble and an extra large shower and some fresh roses in a vase - a very nice touch. We splurged on a breakfast at Bob's -- the Eggs Benedict were (was?) among the best I've had. Our room service breakfast was very good as well. We are part of the free Omni loyalty program. In 2008 this got you free internet, plus free continental breakfast. This year they cut out the breakfast, giving you only coffee and juice of your choice. Still nice. The lobby is beautiful and the staff always courteous and helpful. I also appreciated the hot cider they have in the afternoons.
reviews.title: Birthday celebration

reviews.text: We used the gym which has a nice view of California Street and the cablecar. It's clean and well-equipped if small, but I will say the treadmill I used (the one on the right as you enter the room) was very noisy and I remembered I used the same one in 2008 and apparently it hadn't been fixed.
reviews.title: The hotel was great!!!
What makes this hotel so great is the staff, amenities and location
reviews.text: Our family stayed at the Omni for a week during a vacation to San Francisco in August 2008. The Omni is very well managed and their staff top notch. The concierge, the front desk staff, housekeeping, security and Darryl (the Omni's very cool doorman who helped us secure transportation from the Outer Lands concert at Golden Gate Park to avoid the crowds) are pleasant, responsive and knowledgeable.
We had a wonderful time in San Francisco and the folks at the Omni played a huge role in making it so pleasant.
reviews.title: Outstanding in every way!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We just returned from a 3 night stay at the Omni. It was wonderful in every way. We were celebrating our 40th wedding anniversary, a "big" birthday, and our daughter's graduation from law school. Our room was upgraded to a beautiful suite and immediately after checking we were presented with a bottle of champagne, chocolate covered strawberries and roses!
reviews.title: Overpriced fare for standard experience

reviews.text: The hotel itself is lovely. Old world European look in the lobby, but very comfortable and updated rooms with modern amenities. Perfect location at the edge of the financial district (not overrun with tourists) but close to Chinatown and Union Square. The cable car is right outside the front door.
reviews.title: Great hotel in a great location

reviews.text: But the best part of the experience at this hotel was the people!
reviews.title: Nice, but not a wow
Just returned from an excellent 10 day stay at a truly world class hotel!
reviews.text: We just returned from a 10 day family vacation to San Francisco where we enjoyed 2 connecting rooms at this exquisite hotel. Every moment spent at the San Francisco Omni Hotel was truly a pleasure! I could not have expected more from our entire experience at this hotel. From the timely communication about the reservation and on-line check-in options, the attentive and warm reception received from each staff member at the time of arrival, the wonderful daily amenities received as simply being a member of the FREE Select Guest program, impeccable housekeeping, exceptional dining through room service and Bob's restaurant, the special kid's program that allowed my daughter to feel just as special as we did each and every day...this hotel has all the bases covered! If you wish for your stay in San Francisco to be a true pleasure for both business and personal travel, you will not be disappointed by staying at this truly world class hotel!

reviews.title: A Lovely Stay at the Omni
reviews.text: Very impressed with the online check in. We arrived after a long flight and as we had already "checked in" after receiving the offer to check in via email, so we were able to just collect our key and go straight to our room without having to wait to speak to anybody.

reviews.title: Great deal for the money
reviews.text: Our room was beautifully furnished and we couldn't believe how quiet it was given that the Hotel is on a main road. The location is excellent, cable car runs along the road outside the Hotel and it is only a short walk to the shops in Union Square.

reviews.title: Great Hotel
reviews.text: I agree with a previous reviewer re the cost of breakfast - a little over priced - probably worth a wander to a nearby cafe.

reviews.title: Comfortable Stay, stay on a weekend!
reviews.text: This is a Hotel that feels initmate and cosy, it retains a very classical San Francisco look - nicely done.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I recently spent a birthday week-end at the Omni San Francisco. This was our first stay at an Omni property and we were so impressed that we actually checked to see if there was a hotel in Fort Lauderdale which is where we'll be vacationing next (We have a reservation at a Hilton property but would have switched to the Omni given the wonderful experience we had with them in San Fran.).
reviews.title: Memorable Stay - Superb Service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The front desk staff were very helpful and courteous. We were quite impressed with Crystal who not only answered our questions about hotel amenities but she also anticipated our needs and made arrangements to have them met.
reviews.title: A few glitches - but nice

likes.liked: — Location was great and rooms were good size, clean and comfortable

reviews.text: We were always greeted with a friendly hello by all staff we passed - be it at the front door, in the elevator or in the hallways. There appears to be a seamless team effort to provide polite service at all times and this was quite refreshing to experience.
reviews.title: It was purdy good

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There were personal touches added to the room which we really appreciated. The linens were fresh and clean. Our only disappointment was that there was not much of a view from the room (perhaps because we had requested a quiet area of the hotel?).
reviews.title: Outstanding Customer Service/Wonderful amenities

likes.disliked: — Cable Car and trolley power outages

reviews.text: The hotel is in an excellent location, albeit sedate on the week-end as it's in the Financial district within close proximity to the shopping area on Market street, Little Italy and Chinatown. BART and MUNI are available nearby. We hope to be returning guests.
reviews.title: Where's the pool??

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We recently stayed at the Omni San Francisco for 8 nights and were extremely happy with the room, the staff, (courtesy and efficiency), and the location. Our room was spacious with lovely furnishings, linens, and bath. The view was the only thing that wasn't top notch.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel choice
Great Service! Quiet location. Only steps from everything SF.
reviews.text: We had been concerned about the proximity of night time and Sunday restaurants since the Omni is in the Financial District, but with Tadich down the street and with Belden Lane (a jewel) and its restaurants a block or so away, we had no trouble finding good restaurants within walking distance. We did find the breakfasts expensive in the hotel, but there is a Starbucks right across the street in the Bank of America building.

Actually, everything is quite conveniently located. There is the California cable car line right outside the hotel to get you up Nob Hill, and the Ferry Building is an easy walk away. China Town is quite close, and so is Union Square. The area around the hotel is also much quieter than the Union Square area--a plus for us. And speaking of quiet--the rooms are really quite soundproof. We heard only an occasional door being closed, but never anyone talking.
reviews.title: The Omni has the best location!

reviews.text: The Omni is a wonderful choice for a San Francisco visit.
reviews.title: A wonderful stay at the Omni Hotel San Francisco

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I recently returned from the Omni and was impressed with the quality of service they provided. During the course of a crepe run in the morning, a button on my suit jacket fell off. Upon requesting the front desk personnel that it be repaired, and inquiring about the charge associated with such a repair, I was informed they'd be happy to do it at no charge, and would have it done within 30 minutes, as I was going to be heading back out for the day and needed that jacket. Doorman never let me open my own door, or hail my own cab. They also offered umbrellas if rain was expected and you didn't have one in hand.
reviews.title: Great spot/great location
Nice, but....
reviews.text: We stayed at the Omni for two nights (3/20 & 3/21) and were immediately impressed by the service upon our arrival. Also, the lobby of the hotel was magnificent. We had a Deluxe Room/Parking arrangement which was very economical ($200 per night plus Expedia fees which were a little high) and our request for a quiet room was certainly honored.

reviews.title: One Of the Best
reviews.text: The downsides: while the staff at the Omni is Excellent (with a capital e), it is obvious that they've been a victim of the "more with less" phenomenon currently plaguing the U.S. There was a false fire alarm which occurred which, while not they're fault, delayed our sightseeing as we had locked our camera in our room safe and the safe refused to open. When we informed the front desk, they assured us security would be up shortly. This took almost half an hour and two more calls. It would have been much better if we'd been kept advised as to the progress of security. More importantly, though, it would have been much better if there had been more than one security person available. This became a recurring theme of our stay. We had plumbing issues and it took, again, about half an hour for someone to come. I asked the front desk about whether one of our bags had arrived; they said they'd call me to advise me. When I never got a call, I had to call them again and inferred, from the desk clerk's apology, they'd forgotten to call me.

reviews.title: Omni Hotel, 500 California
reviews.text: Lastly, while our room was quiet, it was a bit run-down (carpet frayed/stained); is this how these "discount" rooms become available to the common masses?

reviews.title: loved the omni
reviews.text: Stayed here at the end of a long trip around the USA and have to say it was just wonderful. All the staff were very friendly and helpful, especially the doorman and front desk staff - even when I forgot my room number! The bed was so comfortable and the room very high quality. I can't recommend this hotel highly enough for comfort and service, can't wait to go back.

reviews.title: Great place to give your car a chance to be stolen
reviews.text: Our family stayed at the Omni for our spring break this year which was March17th-21st. Great service, excellent location in San Francisco and a clean and wonderful room. Our kids, ages 11 and 7, loved the attention from the staff. We loved the location to all the attractions in San Francisco. I would highly recommend the Omni.
An absolutely beautiful hotel--a retrofitting of an old bank building. The location is perfect
reviews.title: Once again--a wonderful experience at an Omni hotel

reviews.text: I got a great rate when I booked on line thru Omni and when I arrived I was pleasantly surprised to find out I had been upgraded to a one-bedroom suite--I can't say enough about the Select Guest Program at The Omni. A fleet of black Town Cars were waiting in front of the hotel to take you shopping, to restaurants, to the airport. The restaurant and bar are excellent as well. The suite was traditional in styling, and very elegant with a large walk-in marble shower. This is a perfect example of why I always stay at Omni hotels.
reviews.title: Excellent Value - Great Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Traveled to San Francisco over the Labor Day weekend with my husband and another couple. We got a great deal on the rooms - prepay for $106 per nite. Never having stayed there I couldn't resist. I'm glad we took the deal. The Omni is in a fantastic location - China town just around the corner, short walks to embarcadero, Union Square, and the trolley runs right in front of the hotel. Tadiche's is only a block away (one of my favorite restaurants). The Carnelian Room is across the street in the Bank of America Bldg. (go quickly - it is set to close at the end of the year) on the 52nd floor, beautiful views of the Golden gate and the bay. Go for a sunset cocktail. It's an intimate room so try to be early for the best tables.
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel - wish we could of stayed longer

reviews.text: The hotel itself could use a little updating. The rooms are big enough, just not very contemporary. A little old fashioned decor-wise. Everything perfectly clean. Comfy bed. The food was great at Bob's in the hotel (love Bob's - we know it from its origins in Dallas) and the scene at the hotel bar was lively. We went every day for an afternoon toddy.
reviews.title: Great Service

reviews.text: All in all a great trip. Don't miss Fisherman's Wharf and the bay cruise - interesting and beautiful. We had an absolutely perfect day. September really is the best weather there.
reviews.title: Excellent Base in Financial District

reviews.text: Two nights on business. Second time at this excellent hotel. Consider this one of the best chain hotels I've stayed in and one of the best in Sand Francisco. All requests made during reservations are met by the Omni.
reviews.title: Top San Francisco Hotel

reviews.text: On the way to airport left cell phone in limo and Lex Doherty, the excellent concierge, arranged for the phone to be sent by FED EX to my home the following morning.
reviews.title: Beautiful Hotel A+

likes.disliked: — that we had to leave.... no negative comments

reviews.text: Hotel has added touches such as a creative way of giving you a semi-complimentary continental breakfast... coffee and juice are free... with minimal charges for extras. CB is delivered to your room with newspapers without all the formality of room service. They leave at door so you don't have to answer immediately early in the AM.
reviews.title: bland & boring

likes.disliked: — blandness of rooms, public rooms & staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Excellent location and very convient and friendly staff.
reviews.title: Great Place, Great Location!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is beautiful and the location could not be more perfect! However it is the staff at the Omni that makes this hotel above the rest. Upon our arrival the front desk assisted my daughter and myself to plan tours, directions and transportation for our stay. Joey "suggested" not pushed on several choices based on our interests. As we were in the first few minutes of unpacking in our room, Joey sent complimentary refreshments via roomservice. The extra attention the entire staff including the housekeeping service was beyond our expectations. Rooms are nice, clean and comfortable. Chinatown and Union Square are within walking distance. Other transportation we purchased the 3 day muni pass and rode the trolley and cable cars to every destination on our list. The suggested tours of Muir Woods and Napa Wine Country were awesome. Tower Tours picked us up from the hotel front door, they were well worth every cent. The tour guide named Will was outstanding. It is recommended 100%. We will certainly return to the Omni for our next visit to this fantastic city and would not even consider another hotel. Although we did not dine at Bob's, I regret not having done so. It will be on the list the next visit!
reviews.title: Great Location, Nice Hotel

likes.disliked: — Had Issues At Front Desk- Minor

reviews.text: I've almost come to expect substandard service from large hotel chains. Thus, I wasn't expecting much from my stay at the Omni in San Francisco and was pleasantly surprised at the high quality of the hotel and its service.
reviews.title: Pleasant Surprise

reviews.text: The rooms are of adequate size and layed out in a manner that lets you either relax or work. There is a nice chair & ottoman and a good-sized desk. The TV rotates fully so that you can actually watch TV from the desk. The bed is comfortable and comes with an array of different styles of pillows. The bathroom is also of decent size and well-lit.
reviews.title: Omni is excellent for business travellers

reviews.text: There is "free" (i.e., no extra charge) high-speed internet service. The bathroom amenities are above average and include bath salts. There is nightly turndown service that includes, if necessary, fresh towels. For rainy days, there is an umbrella in the room and additional umbrellas are available at the front door. An array of newspapers (WSJ, USA Today, SF Chronicle) are available free of charge.
reviews.title: Great Location

reviews.text: The staff is unusually friendly and helpful. Check-in was a breeze. The front desk was never crowded, even though the hotel was. The concierge was helpful. Room service came promptly. Hotel staff greeted you when you arrived and left. Someone was always there to hold the door.
reviews.title: Convenient, Quiet and Hospitable
Stellar Service
reviews.text: The hotel is located a block from Chinatown and close to many good restaurants.

reviews.title: Loved the Omni and SF!
reviews.text: This review is late in coming but as it was one year ago today that we were in SF for our anniversary it made me think of it. I LOVED the Omni (not super modern) and the service was excellent. They upgraded us to a top floor room, with rose petals and wash clothes in the shape of a heart for our anniversary with no charge. The only complaint was the kids in the room next door hanging out their window, smoking half the night. But that was not the Omni's fault. The door men were great and the location was convenient to most of what we wanted to see. Would definitely go back.

reviews.title: Omni-licious
reviews.text: We recently stayed for my young daughters birthday. I was a little nervous because I did not know how they would recieve a us since we had a young child. But that was allieviated when we entered the room and there was a chocolate cake , milk and a birthday card waiting for her. She was so excited!! From the time you walk in the staff is so welcoming and friendly. The room was clean, elegant ,quiet and comfortable. Room service was expensive but prompt and friendly. The beds were so comfortable we stayed in on a Friday night. The staff really do their best to accomodate your every night.

reviews.title: Fantastic experience
reviews.text: Cons: The Wolfgang Puck coffee that is supplied in the room. You can avoid this by becoming a Select member.. and you will get free coffee and newspaper in the morning. This was an inside hint that I got on from this site.

reviews.title: Nice place but no internet...
reviews.text: Suggestions: Would like them to give a little freebie like other hotels i.e. wine and cheese or continental breakfast.

reviews.title: Well run property
reviews.text: Overall I loved it and can't wait to go back.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Brilliant location near Chinatown, very friendly staff, beautiful and tasteful room. Excellent breakfast! We felt at home right from the start and would certainly return. A Chinese couple next to us just got married and half of their party came with them to celebrate an after party in the middle of the night. Luckily this did not take too long. We loved the handwritten note of the housekeeping lady, thanking us for giving her the opportunity to clean our room. It's typical to this place.
reviews.title: Absolutely great

likes.disliked: — Bar staff talking too much to each other

reviews.text: We stayed at the Omni Hotel for 3 nights at the beginning of July. After a 10 hour flight and 8 hours time difference, it was the perfect place to retreat to.
reviews.title: Lovely Hotel

reviews.text: We had previously stayed at the Omni Parker House Hotel in Boston, which exceeded our expectations, so after reading the reviews on TripAdvisor we decided to book the Omni San Francisco.
reviews.title: Poor Experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The two adjoining rooms we stayed in were spacious, very clean and comfortable; the hotel staff could not have been more friendly and welcoming and the restaurant is to be recommended, although there are plenty of restaurants etc within walking distance.
reviews.title: Good location, excellent service, comfortable rooms

reviews.text: Would definitely stay at this hotel in future.
reviews.title: We Love The Omni

reviews.text: There's no view here, but the ambiance and level of service almost make you forget. Extremely convenient to everything - Fisherman's Wharf, Union Square, Market Street, Chinatown. (And yes, there are alternatives to walking up California Street without having a massive coronary! Take a cable car or walk up Post Street) I have stayed at all the major hotels over the years and the Omni is the best - best sized rooms, best location, best staff. Treat yourself to a dose of luxury and stay here.
reviews.title: Superlative!

reviews.text: this hotel is worth the money we spent! we got a great deal through expedia. it's a little higher priced (more than $100 per night) but it was worth it! my review:
reviews.title: top notch hotel
Excellent
reviews.text: 1. we were upgraded to their signature room when we checked in. it's located in the higher floors with high thread count bed linens, an "amazon" shower head, great "roomy" room with luxurious features & design

2. hotel itself is centrally located. if you don't mind walking about 4-5 blocks to: chinatown, nob hill & union square. you can also catch cable car which is right outside the entrance! cable car will take you to most major touristy sights in san fran, including fisherman's wharf.
reviews.title: Outstanding!
Excellent Experience!!!!
reviews.text: 3. staff extremely helpful & friendly.

Sometimes it is the little things that make the difference. While most hotels of "lesser" stars include in-room internet access at no-charge, the Omni charges for this service. The hassle to get it at "no-charge" was time consuming and in the end did not work. Add to it, the lobby internet access worked poorly if at all. Although friendly, the staff didn't seem too concerned about trying to resolve this.
reviews.title: Not worth the price - better value elsewhere
CA Trip
reviews.text: If you need to use the internet for business or email, this hotel is not for you.
Fantastic Hotel, Close to everything you want to visit, staff extremely helpful, make use of the prepaid parking if you take a vehicle
reviews.title: Great choice for a trip to San Francisco

reviews.text: I stayed here for 6 nights and from the moment I arrived felt that I'd made the right choice. The location is perfect with both the main shopping district and the waterfront about 10 minutes walk away. My room was large,pleasantly furnished and well equipped. There was also a decent sized bathroom with a bath.
reviews.title: Excellent!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel offers complimentary coffee in the bar until 10am and in the afternoon there was fruit or biscuits and a seasonal soft beverage on offer - a nice touch. The hotel website has some good offers so it is possible to experience luxury with good service at an affordable price.
reviews.title: Loved it!
Nice place, the Omni San Fransisco.
reviews.text: We did a 4 week tour of the USA over December/January 2007, with 3 older children (girl, 22, boy, 19 and boy, 18), going to San Francisco [Omni Hotel], Miami (South Beach) [Beacon Hotel], Orlando (Disneyworld, Pop Century Resort), Chicago [Drake Hotel], New York (for Christmas) [Beacon Hotel - unrelated to the Beacon in Miami], Boston [Omni Hotel], New York (again) [Roosevelt Hotel] (including New Year’s Eve at the Renaissance Hotel overlooking Times Square), and a day trip to Niagara Falls. It was sometimes very cosy - sometimes downright stressful - with the kids.

reviews.title: I Love This Hotel!!
reviews.text: Anyway, here are my accommodation reviews. I’ll mention side trips and tours too. Sometimes the accommodation was arranged through a travel agent, but on a couple of occasions I organised it direct.

reviews.title: Great Hotel in a Wonderful City
reviews.text: The Omni was arranged through a travel agent in Brisbane, though as usual I had checked with Trip Advisor, and then asked the travel agent to book it when I was satisfied. He got me better rates than going to the hotel direct, too. We were also staying at an Omni in Boston, and as I'd joined the Omni's Select Guest program (free, via the internet), there were advantages to be had. Plus, we'd previously stayed at the Omni in Washington and it was spectacular (my favourite of the 3 Omnis I've stayed in whilst in the USA), so we thought it would be good.

reviews.title: Classy Place to stay
reviews.text: We weren't disappointed. Fairly large rooms (we had a double and a triple, though the kids weren't particularly happy at 2 of them having to share a double bed - but then, they're not paying!); interconnecting which was useful. Free internet (I had a laptop) for Select Guest members (if you stay at the Omni, the Select Guest program is recommended - free juice/coffee and newspaper delivered every morning). Very reasonably sized bathroom. In all, very comfortable.

reviews.title: Outstanding value - impeccable and great location
reviews.text: It's a grand building with an impressive foyer. We received a lovely sincere welcome from the bell captain on arriving.

description: The Omni San Francisco Hotel provides luxury accommodations in the heart of downtown San Francisco - the jewel of California. This beautiful downtown hotel is located right on the cable car line and is only a short walk to Union Square, the San Francisco neighborhood that has become a mecca for high-end shopping and art galleries. Ideal for a romantic getaway, the Omni San Francisco Hotel offers modern amenities in a boutique ambiance due to its Florentine Renaissance architecture. Built as a bank in 1926, the lobby is adorned with Italian marble, rich fabrics and Austrian crystal chandeliers.This classic elegance makes the hotel the perfect location for a memorable wedding reception. Bob's Steak & Chop House has carved out a reputation as one of America’s great steak houses. From great food to attentive and seasoned wait staff, Bob’s Steak & Chop House offers an unmatched dining experience in the heart of San Francisco. Located just 20 minutes from San Francisco International Airport.
